bioghist.p: James Dick Smart (b. 1906) was a Canadian Presbyterian minister. He served as editor-in-chief of the New Curriculum for the Presbyterian Church USA from 1944-1950. He returned to Canada as minister of Rosedale Presbyterian Church in Toronto, Ontario, where he served until 1957. From 1957 to 1969 he was Jessup Professor of Biblical Interpretation at Union Theological Seminary in New York. He wrote 20 books and many sermons, lectures, and book reviews. At the time of his death, he had completed two volumes of his memoirs (unpublished).

scopecontent.p: This is collection of papers of James D. Smart. Materials include: manuscript lecture notes for courses and notes for articles; 1931 thesis for Ph.D. from the University of Toronto, "The Personal Element in Isaiah 40-66"; syllabi and exam questions from Union Theological Seminary; manuscript and typed notes for sermons; typescript manuscripts and manuscript notes for articles and books by Smart, including Memoirs of a Ministry, volumes 1 and 2; reprints by Smart and others; a small number of personal financial records; and printed booklets of catechisms and confessions. The collection also includes minutes of several councils and committees of interdenominational organizations (Reformed Churches), 1970s and early 1980s; and minutes and reports of the General Assembly's Committee on a Brief Contemporary Statement of Faith (1959-1964).
